main event: An elongated object of golden silver color, hovering at 20 degrees, on a drift, suddenly accelerated and went out of sight toward the horizon in the West.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 5 minutes.
The object suddenly accelerated and went out of sight toward the horizon.
The report includes photographs of the object.
The conclusion was that the object was probably a cloud reflecting the sun's rays with a drifting pattern of reflection.
The witness was a principal at a rural high school who reported the sighting to the Air Force Liaison Officer with the Civil Air Patrol.
location: About 30 miles north of Louisville, Kentucky
witnesses: a principal at a rural high school
